Chris-Aksel not the only difference. Stun uploaded the original rar files, but you uploaded the isos. Of course both torrents are good. It's a matter of preference.

I prefer the original rar files always. They come with sfv and thus I can verify file integrity.

I would suggest if you can to include with your torrents md5 and sha1 checksums for the iso images. That way we can always verify the files.

Before you say that torrents have internal hash check, I can tell you that nothing is guaranteed. For example, uTorrent has a big bug with its write caching method. Few times it can corrupt files, even though force recheck says that all is ok. It happened to me a least two times in the past. There is though a workaround for uTorrent to bypass this bug.

Anyway, sorry for my mumbling :D

Thanks for the upload and all your efforts. :)

Greets,

To the "Dont Pirate THis": The thing is, that other than the poeple who download to demo the game to then buy, are the people that can not afford to buy, will just get 2nd hand, or just will never buy a game. So in essence the developer is not losing sales by their software being pirated. # of downloads in no way equals or even comes close to their amount of lost sales.
END QUOTE------

I can't afford a Ferrari.  So does that mean I should be able to steal one since I'm not hurting their sales because I wouldn't buy one to begin with?

PC Games get hurt by piracy the most out of all industries.  Software in general is actually the only kind of content that gets hurt by piracy for the most part.

So don't try to make some crazy excuse to justify that you're a broke hobo and steal all of your entertainment.

SUPPORT THE DEVELOPERS... BUY THE GAME IF YOU LIKE IT!!!  

Otherwise,  the good games will become less and less often because there just isn't enough budget and WE will end up suffering in the end.   We are destroying our own entertainment sources!  Remember that

I say: No. Even if it was impossible for me to get a pirated game I wouldn't buy one, as I cannot afford. Sou you are not losing any sale.
Maybe I could by those legacy games from Steam, that are cheap, but not the fresh expensive releases. They are cheaper at US, but I'm from Brazil, here the import taxes are extremely high, making the prices on imported products go about 100% (or more) higher than at US. Not saying about the minimum wage here that is equivalent to US$ 377.

System requirements

Minimum system requirements

* OS: Windows XP, Vista or Windows 7
* CPU: Intel Core 2 Duo 2.2 GHz or similar AMD
* RAM: 2 GB (XP) / 3 GB (Vista/7)
* HDD: 8 GB free disk space
* Graphics: 512 MB Graphics Memory (Nvidia GF 8800 or similar ATI card)
* Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible
* DirectX: Version 9.0c

Recommended system requirements

* OS: Windows XP, Vista or Windows 7
* CPU: Intel Core 2 Duo E6750 2.66GHz
* RAM: 4 GB
* HDD: 8GB (for game and 8 GB bonus content) free disk space
* Graphics: 512 MB Graphics Memory (GeForce GTS 450 or ATI Radeon HD 4850)
* Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible
* DirectX: Version 9.0c
